data.question: We can go to a movie if you —— interested.
I would fly, if I —— bird.
If I had had money, I —— bought a new car.
If she played well, they —— win the match.
I look forward to —— you again.
data.moreDetails:
(would you mind, do you mind, look forward to, accustomed to, with a view to,
enjoy, dislike, keep, busy, avoid, can't help, can't stand, Insist on, prefer, stop
-> only use gerund (v1 + ing) form after these words.

data.question: Carry an umbrella lest it —— rain.
She had nothing else to do —— cry.
They would rather —— at home than go out.
They came here —— a train.
data.moreDetails:
* Rules: Name of vehicles -> by
An article (a, an, the) or a possessive pronoun (my, our, your, their, his her
its) comes with vehicle should be used in/ on.
* bus, train, plane, ship -> on
* car, Jeep -> in
* Two wheeler, foot, animal, animal cart -> on
* way of travelling (road/ land, air, water) -> by

data.question: He shared his property —— his wife his son and his daughter.
